alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ascension, southeastern West Baton Rouge, west central Livingston, southeastern Iberville and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 345 PM CDT... At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Plaquemine, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, White Castle, Port Vincent, Westminster, Old Jefferson, Merrydale, Inniswold, Prairieville, Village St. George, Bayou Sorrel, Shenandoah, Gardere, Carville and Geismar. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 151 and 175. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Northern Livingston; West Baton Rouge
